newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkey orders Islamist firm to disclose names.
newsitem.headline: Turkey orders Islamist firm to disclose names.

text.p: Turkey's financial markets watchdog has ordered the huge Islamist Kombassan Holding to disclose the identities of all who have invested in the company and the size of their stakes, state-run Anatolian news agency said on Monday.
The company must submit the information to the Capital Markets Board (SPK) before July 30, Anatolian quoted the SPK's weekly bulletin as saying.
On June 17 a Turkish court froze 14.9 trillion lira belonging to Kombassan over allegations that it had raised capital without the consent of the SPK.
Kombassan is active in printing, paper and machinery production and construction.
The company, run from the Islamist stronghold of Konya, is one of a number of Islamist businesses targeted by Turkey's secular military for allegedly funding religious radicalism.
